title: File I/O and Basic Data Analysis

questions.question: What does I/O stand for in the context of file operations?
Which file mode is used to open a file for reading in Python?
What does CSV stand for?
Which Python module is commonly used for working with CSV files?
What is the purpose of the 'with' statement when opening files in Python?
choices: To automatically close the file after operations are complete
questions.answer: To automatically close the file after operations are complete

questions.question: Which file mode would you use to append data to an existing file?
What is the primary advantage of using CSV files for data storage?
choices: They are simple and widely supported
They can store complex data structures
questions.answer: They are simple and widely supported

questions.question: In Python, which function is used to skip the header row when reading a CSV file?
What is the purpose of basic data analysis?
choices: To extract meaningful insights from data
questions.answer: To extract meaningful insights from data

questions.question: Which Python function is used to calculate the average of a list of numbers?
What is the correct way to open a file named 'data.txt' for writing in Python?
Which method is used to write a string to a file in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'newline' parameter when opening a CSV file?
choices: To handle different line ending conventions
To add a new line after each row
To remove empty lines from the file
To specify the number of lines to read
questions.answer: To handle different line ending conventions

questions.question: Which Python library is commonly used for more advanced data analysis and manipulation?
What does the 'strip()' method do when reading lines from a file?
choices: Removes all spaces from the line

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common file operation?
What is the purpose of the 'delimiter' parameter in CSV operations?
choices: To specify the character separating values
To set the maximum file size
To define the number of columns
questions.answer: To specify the character separating values

questions.question: Which method would you use to read the entire contents of a file as a single string?
What is the main difference between 'w' and 'a' file modes?
choices: 'w' overwrites existing content, 'a' appends to it
'w' is for writing, 'a' is for reading
'w' is for text files, 'a' is for binary files
questions.answer: 'w' overwrites existing content, 'a' appends to it

questions.question: Which function would you use to find the highest value in a list of numbers?
What is the purpose of the 'encoding' parameter when opening a file?
choices: To specify the character encoding of the file
questions.answer: To specify the character encoding of the file

questions.question: Which method is used to write a list of strings as a CSV row?
What does the 'seek()' method do when working with files?
choices: Changes the current position within the file
Searches for a specific string in the file
Skips a number of lines in the file
Seals the file to prevent further modifications
questions.answer: Changes the current position within the file

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid file mode in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'DictReader' class in Python's csv module?
choices: To read CSV files as dictionaries
To create dictionaries from CSV data
questions.answer: To read CSV files as dictionaries

questions.question: Which function would you use to calculate the median of a list of numbers in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'tell()' method when working with files?
choices: Returns the current position within the file
Tells you if the file is open or closed
Provides information about the file's contents
questions.answer: Returns the current position within the file

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common operation in basic data analysis?
What is the purpose of the 'groupby()' function in pandas?
choices: To group data based on a specific column or criteria
questions.answer: To group data based on a specific column or criteria

questions.question: Which method would you use to add a new column to a pandas DataFrame?
